meanings.definition: The amount by which destruction or the capacity for destruction exceeds what is necessary.
meanings.sent1: The overkill of fireworks in the sky was dazzling.
meanings.sent2: The military operation was a classic example of overkill.
meanings.sent3: The overkill of confetti at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The overkill of colors in the painting created a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent5: The overkill of toppings on the ice cream sundae made it a work of art.

meanings.definition: To destroy or obliterate to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: He didn't just defeat his opponent, he overkilled him.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to overkill the competition with their new product.
meanings.sent3: She overkilled the cake by adding too much frosting.
meanings.sent4: The storm overkilled the fragile garden plants.
meanings.sent5: The detective's interrogation tactics were so intense, they overkilled the suspect.
